latestVersion.termsOfUse: This dataset is available for use via a Creative Commons CC-BY license.
latestVersion.termsOfAccess: Additional data and associated records are accessible onsite at the Center for the History of Medicine, Francis A. Countway Library of Medicine, Boston, Massachusetts. Files containing health, personnel, and student information are restricted for 80 years; files containing university records are restricted for 50 years. Access requires advance notice. Contact Public Services for more information about accessing the collection.

authorName.value: Harvard School of Public Health. Longitudinal Studies of Child Health and Development

authorAffiliation.value: Harvard School of Public Health. Department of Maternal and Child Health

datasetContactName.value: Center for the History of Medicine (Francis A. Countway Library of Medicine)

dsDescriptionValue.value:
This dataset represents a group of paper records (a "series") within the Harvard School of Public Health Longitudinal Studies of Child Health and Development records, 1918-2015 (inclusive), 1930-1989 (bulk), which can be accessed on-site at the Center for the History of Medicine at the Francis A. Countway Library of Medicine in Boston, Massachusetts. The series consists of subject participation records, personnel records, regulatory records, and other research administrative records, generated during the thirty-year follow-up study of the Harvard School of Public Health Longitudinal Studies of Child Health and Development.

Subject participation records include subject lists, appointment scheduling records, and correspondence. Personnel records consist of curricula vitae, recruitment records, and employment-related correspondence. Regulatory records consist of: protocols and methodologies; codebooks; and blank data collection instruments. Administrative records also include: report drafts; collected resources; and correspondence. Some records are in French.

Attached to the "Administrative and Regulatory Records, 1943-1979" dataset are files, digitized from their original paper copies, that serve as examples of the records that may be found in the series. Additional data and associated records are accessible onsite at the Center for the History of Medicine per the conditions governing access described below.

Conditions Governing Access to Original Collection Materials: The series represented by this dataverse includes longitudinal patient information that is restricted for 80 years from the most recently dated records in the collection, personnel information that is restricted for 80 years from the date of record creation, and Harvard University records that are restricted for 50 years from the date of record creation. The end of the restricted period is noted with each folder. Researchers should contact Public Services for more information.

The Harvard School of Public Health Longitudinal Studies of Child Health and Development records were processed with grant funding from the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation, as awarded and administered by the Council on Library and Information Resources (CLIR) in 2016. An online finding aid to the collection may be accessed here: http://nrs.harvard.edu/urn-3:HMS.Count:med00211

seriesInformation.value: The Harvard School of Public Health Longitudinal Studies of Child Health and Development records, 1918-2015 (inclusive), 1930-1989 (bulk), are the product of research by the Department of Maternal and Child Health on the health, physical development, and social functioning of a set of subjects from birth through adulthood.

files.description: Methodology and data collection instrument used for anthropometric measurements during the 30-year follow-up study. The procedure was developed by Dr. Albert Damon.
files.label: Anthropometric Measurements Protocol and Record

dataFile.description: Methodology and data collection instrument used for anthropometric measurements during the 30-year follow-up study. The procedure was developed by Dr. Albert Damon.

files.description: Blank data collection instrument used for physical examination data (health history, family history, hospitalizations, systems, health and dietary habits, and physical examination) during the 30-year follow-up study.
files.label: Health History and Physical Examination Record

dataFile.filename: Health History and Physical Examination Record
dataFile.description: Blank data collection instrument used for physical examination data (health history, family history, hospitalizations, systems, health and dietary habits, and physical examination) during the 30-year follow-up study.

files.description: Blank data collection instrument used in the 30-year follow-up study to record subject's health, illnesses, surgeries, accidents, and pregnancies since the 30th year follow-up study.
files.label: Health History Questionnaire

dataFile.description: Blank data collection instrument used in the 30-year follow-up study to record subject's health, illnesses, surgeries, accidents, and pregnancies since the 30th year follow-up study.

files.description: Methodology and data collection instruments used for nutrition data during the 30-year follow-up study. The records include interview sheets regarding the previous day's diet, a table for calculating nutritive intake, and a table for estimating the type of fat consumed.
files.label: Nutrition Interview Protocol and Records

dataFile.description: Methodology and data collection instruments used for nutrition data during the 30-year follow-up study. The records include interview sheets regarding the previous day's diet, a table for calculating nutritive intake, and a table for estimating the type of fat consumed.

files.description: Methodology and data collection instrument used for ophthalmological data during the 30-year follow-up study.
files.label: Ophthalmological Examination Protocol and Record

dataFile.description: Methodology and data collection instrument used for ophthalmological data during the 30-year follow-up study.

files.description: Blank survey instrument, "A Social Work Study of The Relationship of Childhood Behavior and Adult Social Functioning. A Research Instrument for Collection and Classification of Data on Social Functioning," used in the 30-year follow-up study. The instrument, dated 1965, was developed by Isabelle Valadian and Ruth M. Butler. Due to the size of the instrument, only the title page, table of contents, and interviewer instruction page have been digitized and included in Dataverse. The complete instrument is available in the paper collection. Topics include subject's behavior during the interview, and social functioning in educational, military, work, home, and social situations.
files.label: Social Work Study Survey Instrument - Title Page, Table of Contents, and Interviewer Instructions

dataFile.filename: Social Work Study Survey Instrument - Title Page, Table of Contents, and Interviewer Instructions
dataFile.description: Blank survey instrument, "A Social Work Study of The Relationship of Childhood Behavior and Adult Social Functioning. Butler. Due to the size of the instrument, only the title page, table of contents, and interviewer instruction page have been digitized and included in Dataverse. The complete instrument is available in the paper collection. Topics include subject's behavior during the interview, and social functioning in educational, military, work, home, and social situations.
